thread.title: Bison rally to defeat Green Hornets
thread.title_full: Bison rally to defeat Green Hornets

title: Bison rally to defeat Green Hornets
text:
Bison rally to defeat Green Hornets Staff Report 9:45 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 File CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BUFFALO GAP â€” After dropping a close first set Thursday night, Buffalo Gap settled in to defeat Wilson Memorial 23-25, 25-21, 25-12, 25-17 in volleyball action. 
Gap was led by Sierra Clifton with 19 kills, 19 digs, and five service points. Abby Flint had a strong game as well with 10 aces, five kills, and 15 points. Camille Ashby had eight aces to go with 16 points and a game high 41 assists. Emily Hanger had 17 kills and four points and Emily McComas led her team with 24 digs. 
For the Green Hornets, Abby Taylor led the way with 14 kills, 11 aces and 15 digs. Hannah Johnson added seven kills, 14 assists and 11 digs while Emma Harrison contributed seven kills and three blocks. 
In the JV game, Wilson prevailed in three sets 14-25, 25-21 and 16-14. For Gap in that match, Olivia Marrin had 18 points. 
With the win, the Bison improve to 6-5 on the season and head to Page County Monday. The loss drops Wilson to 8-6 and they will host Luray on Tuesday. Read or Share this story: http://www.newsleader.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/08/bison-rally-defeat-green-hornets/73622604/ TOP VIDEOS
